content: We reported the first quarter 2022 net income of $20.7 million or $0.68 per diluted share, down from our fourth quarter, but up nicely from $16.7 million or $0.54 per diluted share in the first quarter of 2021. First quarter production volumes were $507 million, 19% lower than the record high fourth quarter and more than doubled our first quarter production last year, excluding PPP loans. Commitments on commercial lines of credit increased to $814 million at the end of first quarter, an increase of $42 million or 5.4% from the prior quarter and $210 million or 35% year-over-year. Residential mortgage production, which consists of non-QM loans, was $60 million in the quarter and represented 12% of the total loan and lease production. Given our overall solid loan and lease production in the first quarter, our loan portfolio increased 3.6% from the previous quarter to $5.3 billion and was also up 10.8% from the first quarter of 2021. As Bonnie mentioned, this portfolio has grown by 23% since last year to $663 million in the first quarter and is up 4.7% from the fourth quarter. The volume of loans sold in the first quarter declined, as expected, to $29.6 million from $36.6 million in the fourth quarter. The allowance for credit losses was $71.5 million as of March 31, 2022, generating an allowance for credit losses to loans of 1.34% compared with 1.41% at the end of the prior quarter. We recorded a provision for income taxes of $8.5 million for the first quarter, representing a more normalized tax rate of 29%, up from the fourth quarter where we benefited from charges in our deferred tax asset valuation allowance. However, our TCE ratio declined 1.7% from the previous quarter because of the $36.4 million after-tax increase in unrealized losses on our securities portfolio arising from the rapid and sizable increase in interest rates.
